text: National Movement for the Liberation of the Central African Republic (MNLC, ) was a rebel group in the Central African Republic based in northwestern part of country. == History == In 2017, a new rebel group named MNLC was formed in Central African Republic. Media reports connect the new MNLC to outbursts of violence in the Central African Republic.CAR violence rises: 'They shot my children and husband'. Al Jazeera, 12 February 2018. NGO International Crisis Group reports that "clashes between armed groups National Movement for the Liberation of the Central African Republic (MNLC) and Revolution and Justice (RJ) intensified" in January 2018.Crisis Watch: Central African Republic. International Crisis Group, January 2018. On May 2018 its leader, Ahmat Bahar announced that group was merging with Central African Patriotic Movement. In October 2019 Ahamat Bahar was reportedly arrested in Goré in Chad after he fled Central African Republic two months before. == References == Category:Factions of the Central African Republic Civil War (2012–present) Category:Rebel groups in the Central African Republic
title: National Movement for the Liberation of the Central African Republic
